main event: An observer reported a glowing red-green light in the eastern sky for one hour in Newtown, Pennsylvania on November 13, 1966.
interesting points: The object was observed to be stationary, appearing and disappearing repeatedly in the sky., The observation lasted for about one hour., The sighting was noted to coincide with the rising of the star Sirius., The Big Dipper was not visible at the time of the sighting., There was no physical evidence left behind.
witness description: The observer noted details about the light's color and behavior.
